comment: Is a really useful  training aid

author: Jackie Kelly
comment: Used it for the first time today and worked really well. We are in a remote, heavily treed area and it was able to track us.
Nice app !

author: Stewart Robinson
comment: If you are a slow walker, like after having surgery, if you walk under 2.5 Kilometres an hour, it keeps pausing and restarting your workout. This gives incredible times for the distance you walk. If you have a bad walk with a lot of pain the time you took according to the programme can be faster than when you had a good day with minimal pain and walked very fast. This is unacceptable. You want to know your genuine time for the walk with no automatic pauses and restarts deducted from your total time.

author: Joanne Hall
comment: This app used to be really good and reliable. Just lately it has been nothing but trouble. It will record time and calories but not the distance. I have been to the help page and done everything it tells me to on there. I have also restarted my phone and it is still not working. I know it is not my phone because the person I walk with is having exactly the same problem. I notice when you put it into google search a lot of other people are having the same trouble. Unless Map My Walk get this sorted then I will be looking for a more reliable app.

author: John Krug
comment: I used this app throughout 2017 with great success.  It helped me lose over 40 pounds in six months. The recent update however does not sync well within the Android OS on the S7, requiring the battery/sleep settings to be reset before every use in order to allow the app to work with the phone's GPS.  Despite saving settings repeatedly, the two default back to a state that prevents GPS tracking within the app.  An app that requires changes to the battery settings before every use is not convenient enough to use.

author: Tim ffitch
comment: A good app normally but lately it stops tracking my location if I don't continually check the phone. Seems to be about 10 minutes after you last used the phone. Really annoying. I don't know if it's an OS issue or an app issue.

author: Jo Langevin-Tozer
comment: Just wanted to use app to measure where i walk my dog. It worked great! It didnt talk incessantly and  told me when i paused and started. I have a bad habit of thinking i hit the button when i haven't. It let me know when i was good to go.

author: fergcharminx Carr
comment: In accurate. Stopped mapping my walk part way. Told me I only walked 1.8 K of a 2.7 walk. When finished I drove the route and I had done over 3 ks  .will be getting a pedometer for accuracy

author: Sydney Hager
comment: Good app, but not sure of the accuracy.  I used it with my Garmin gps and it showed almost 2/10ths of a mile farther for 3.31 miles, according to my Garmin.  Not sure which one is correct.  Overall it's a nice app.

author: Goddess Momma
comment: Sucks ass. Tried app for a solid week" 4x a day. An example: I live in northwest and it mark my walk in Florida. FLORIDA?! Thumbnail routes ALWAYS wrong. Time of day i exercised wrong. WHO KNOWS if length of time exercised and distanced travelled is accurate!

author: Katie Cottrell
comment: Disappointed. On my first walk it didn't track me for 10 minutes until I checked it. So I cancelled the walk and started again, this time rather than the 'L' shape I walked, the map thought I did a diaganol over the houses....

author: Dee Stew
comment: Great for tracking distance, time and pace. Calories burned is about 30% more than any exercise calculator I have used including Myfitpal.

author: Cody McIntyre
comment: Amazing how the only pedometer app that actually syncs with MyFitnessPal is Under Armor's own proprietary bloatware. 70+ megabytes for a simple pedometer? Get outta here.

author: Bob the builder pyrkowski
comment: Just walked over an hour and it didn't record any mileage and yes my GPS is turned on I will be deleting this app

author: Mark Geisthardt
comment: It's just fun to know how far you've gone and how long it took. Plus it gives you a map that is especially helpful when walking someplace you're unfamiliar with.

author: Andrea Grocott
comment: She tells you your distance, time lapsed and steps. And split time. At each kilometre. It's great. I'm happy with this app.
I have purchased + version earlier but i am told to uninstall it because it is not supported so my money was wasted.

author: Dulcie Long
comment: Exactly what I needed to train for fitness tests. Time, distance, splits & calorie burn.

author: Phillip Hasley
comment: So slow on my Galaxy s5. Takes 38 seconds to open the app. Come on man! Make it faster to start. Otherwise it's fine.

author: Eric English
comment: Bit laggy, too many ads. Does the job but not great.

author: Harold Stafford
comment: Very good app, syncs with My Fitness Pal and seems pretty accurate. But some of the features are hidden behind a subscription wall, even if you already pay the yearly subscription to My Fitness Pal. Would like to see one price subscription to all these UA apps instead of different subs for everything.

author: Chris Cowap
comment: Exactly what I wanted. Not sure if it takes account of changes in elevation though

author: Diana Andrews
comment: Easy to use and great to save and have personal history. Encouraging for motivation for fitness. Make sure intermittent stops turned off

author: abhi jana
comment: At times this app misses the track particularly if it is running on background n if there is an ongoing phone call. This results in inaccurate track reflection.

author: Gary Olsen
comment: It does a good job mapping and providing accurate workout data. It has a very simple interface which is good when I don't want to page through menus as I'm eager to get on with it.

author: Catrina Reed
comment: Love this app! It is easy to use and helps me stay on track with my workouts. Also, it easily syncs to My Fitness Pal so I don't have to enter workouts anymore

author: Jill Lageman
comment: Really great app for keeping me motivated and tracking my progress.

author: Caroline Bray
comment: One my fav apps, new version w hands free pause your map very irritating,  paused 20+times in one walk !! Thanks 2015  Now 2018- and I still love this app, wish I could get it to work in my new phone maybe just an update is needed

author: Gregory Wolfe
comment: I dont know all what it can do. I mainly use it to keep track of my walking distance and keep track of it.
Great app. It actually pushed to do a bit more than i planed

author: LittleKoala Books
comment: Keeps logging generic workouts on days that I didn't even open the app. Sometimes multiple times a day.

author: Isaac Aidoo
comment: It would be great if the units could be changed by the user to suit the user. Some of us cannot appreciate Miles for example. There should be option for metric units
My sister uses this app and encouraged me to try. It does everything it claims and does feel like having a coach and a friend along the way..... Thanks Sis! ❤

author: Shane St. Lawrence
comment: I used to love this app until Under Armour got involved.  It seems like the GPS stop linking Galaxy phone after an MMW update.

author: Allison Atkinson
comment: Good app... Wish I had found something that gives me auditory speed feedback... So I don't slack off on my walk

author: Vic Ambanta
comment: The GPS tracker gets crazy at times. It doesn't see me.

author: prashant srivastava
comment: Distance measure is not correct instead of 2km it's showing .22m.

author: Pam Mathews
comment: Can't figure out howto sync with my fitness pal

author: Stacey Holmes
comment: Only mapped one walk so far hoping it will sync with my calorie tracker without issue. Was very easy to connect the apps
